notes: A detachment of a joint police and military anti-robbery squad ("Operation Flush") intercepted a group of members of the Boko Haram sect militia riding motorbikes during a funeral procession for not wearing crash helmets, leading to an argument between the two groups and to the fatal shooting of 17 of the Boko Haram members by one of the security officers. This event is thought to have triggered a large wave of anti-government uprisings the following month.

notes: Members of the Boko Haram sect militia attacked and destroyed the Dutsen Tanshi police station in Bauchi in retaliation for the killing of 17 of its members on 11 June by security forces in Maiduguri. This attack is thought to have sparked off a wave of unrest, which swept through Bauchi, Borno, Kano, Katsina and Yobe states until at least 30 July, when Boko Harams leader was captured and later killed by police.

notes: Suspected members of an Islamist sect that launched an uprising last year have killed a retired police officer in a hit-and-run shooting. actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Islamists killed two people in northern Nigeria. From eyewitness accounts, the modus operandi of the attackers was similar to that applied in previous attacks. The fact that the assailants came on a motorbike, opened fire on their victims and sped away gives rise to some suspicion that the attackers were Boko Haram members.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Gunmen attacked the home of Ali Modu, the speaker of the Borno state House of Assembly in a suburb of Maiduguri and killed a security guard.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Gunmen suspected to be members of the Boko Haram sect gained access to the home of a national vice chairman of the All Nigeria Peoples Party (ANPP) in Maiduguri and killed him.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Two gunmen on a motorcycle shot dead outspoken cleric Bashir Kashara outside his house in the heart of Maiduguri city.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Gunmen killed two policemen manning a checkpoint in northern Nigeria in the latest in a wave of such shootings that have raised alarm over rebels from an Islamist sect. The attack led authorities to announce that they were banning the night-time use of motorcycles in the city of Bauchi, where the shootings occurred.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Islamist sect members have killed an off-duty policeman on the outskirts of Maiduguri. Motorcycle-riding gunmen killed the officer on Tuesday night as he was walking home.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Gunmen suspected of being members of Boko Haram Islamist sect have shot dead a local chief in northern Nigeria. Tukur Ahmad, a neighbourhood chief in northern city of Bauchi was killed by two unidentified gunmen outside his house Friday night shortly after attending Muslim prayers in a nearby mosque.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Suspected members of a radical Islamist sect in northern Nigeria firebombed a police station over the weekend, leading to a gun fight in which at least one person was killed.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: A suspected member of Islamist sect, Boko Haram, tried to shoot a local traditional leader at his house in Maiduguri. The local chief in the city of Maiduguri managed to wrestle the assailant, who was armed with a Kalashnikov rifle, and overpower him before he was able to open fire.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Two motorcycle-riding gunmen suspected of belonging to the Boko Haram sect shot dead an off-duty soldier who was recovering from an undisclosed illness, and also shot and wounded his friend in Zinnari district of Maiduguri in the early hours of Saturday morning.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Suspected Boko Haram members opened fire on worshippers at a Wahabi mosque in Maiduguri shortly before Friday prayers, killing three, including a young boy. The Boko Haram sect considers Saudi-inclined Wahabi Muslims to be heretics for their vehement opposition to Boko Harams ideology of violence and its aversion to Western education.

notes: Gunmen suspected of being members of Boko Haram Islamist sect have shot dead two off-duty policemen in Bulunkutu area of Maiduguri while waiting to board a bus home after work. The two policemen were killed by four gunmen who fired at them from inside a car before speeding off.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: A police checkpoint in the city of Maiduguri, the centre of last years uprising, came under fire from attackers and officers shot back. The police had superior power which forced the attackers believed to be members of Boko Haram to flee and no casualty was recorded.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Gunmen suspected of belonging to a radical Islamic sect, Boko Haram, launched an attack on a military patrol, burning a military vehicle. Scores of gunmen stormed the neighbourhood where the patrol team was stationed and opened fire on soldiers. The soldiers fired back, resulting in a shootout that lasted for about two hours. One attacker was shot and captured.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: An explosion killed at least 8 people and wounded red dozens more in a village near the central Nigerian city of Jos. Boko Haram later claimed responsibility.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: In a separate series of explosions, homemade devices killed at least 24 in a second location in Jos, and injured a further 74. Boko Haram later claimed responsibility.

notes: Suspected Islamist sect members of Boko Haram attacked a church during Christmas Eve services in northern Nigeria on Friday, but were repelled by the military after a gun battle and no worshippers were killed.

notes: Suspected members of an Islamist sect blamed for a series of attacks in Nigeria's north shot dead a soldier guarding a church on Sunday and stole his rifle. Attackers on motorcycles killed the soldier in the city of Maiduguri.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Suspected members of an Islamist sect opened fire at a checkpoint in northern Nigeria, killing a soldier. The attackers killed the soldier on Sunday night and wounded two others at a checkpoint in the town of Biu, 200 kilometres (125 miles) south of Maiduguri.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Motorcycle-riding gunmen killed an off-duty military officer as he exited a mosque in Maiduguri.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Gunmen suspected to be members of Islamist sect Boko Haram opened fire on police guarding voter registration equipment at a school in northern Nigeria, killing one officer and critically injuring another. Officers engaged in a shootout with the gunmen for about five minutes but were overpowered.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Motorcycle-riding attackers stabbed three University of Jos students, leading to protests and clashes over the following days.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Gunmen shot dead a leading governorship candidate and six others on Friday in northern Nigeria in a suspected political assassination ahead of April elections. Witnesses said that four gunmen arrived on two motorbikes as Modu Fannami Gubio was sitting outside after greeting his father following Fridays Muslim. Others killed were his younger brother, security aides and political associates. Boko Haram later claimed responsibility for the attack.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Elsewhere in Maiduguri, gunmen attacked an army checkpoint Saturday night, damaging a military vehicle in a four-minute gun battle.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Two suspected members of an Islamist sect and a policeman were killed Sunday in a checkpoint shootout. The gunmen who arrived in a car opened fire on the three policemen on duty at the check point who returned fire that led to a shootout in which two of the attackers and a police corporal were killed.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Suspected members of a radical Islamist sect in northeastern Nigeria shot dead a senior police officer on Tuesday. The assailants opened fire on his car, killing him on the spot and critically injuring his young daughter who was with him.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: A policeman was shot and killed and another one badly injured by gunmen suspected to be members of Boko Haram who attacked the house of the police area commander in Biu where the policemen were on duty guarding the residence.

notes: Police said they had shot dead a man financing a radical Islamist sect in northern Nigeria and arrested another man suspected of supplying the group with arms. The man financing the Bokom Haram sect was killed when a shootout broke out during a raid on one of the groups hideouts.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Gunmen suspected to belong to Boko Haram went to the residence of an off-duty police inspector where he was sitting with his friend and shot him in the chest and thigh. The officer succeeded in killing one of his assailants before he died.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Motor-cycle riding gunmen shot another off-duty policeman along airport road on his way home less than an hour after the first attack.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Gunmen shot and killed a Muslim cleric highly critical of a hard-line Islamist sect, in an attack outside his home in Maiduguri. The victim had been an outspoken critic of the radical Islamist group known as Boko Haram.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Gunmen on Friday shot dead a Muslim cleric in northern Nigeria. Four gunmen knocked on the door of the clerics home in the city of Maiduguri and shot him in the stomach and thigh.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Four gunmen suspected to be members of a radical Islamist sect opened fire on a group of party politicians in eastern Nigeria. The attackers shot Modu Gana Makanike, an All Nigerian Peoples Party (ANPP) youth leader, in the chest and head shortly after a political meeting Sunday of party chieftains in the city of Maiduguri.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Suspected Islamist sect members on Tuesday opened fire outside of a political rally in northern Nigeria, sparking panic and a stampede that killed at least four people. Three suspected members of Boko Haram fired several shots from their AK-47 rifles from outside the venue, which caused panic and a stampede among party supporters attending the rally. This resulted in the deaths of four people. The attackers slipped away before they could be arrested.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: A Muslim cleric critical of a radical Islamic sect in northern Nigeria late Wednesday escaped a bomb attack by suspected Islamists that destroyed his drug store. Two motorcycle-riding suspected members of Boko Haram in the northern city of Maiduguri threw a home-made bomb into the store of Muhammad Mustapha, a druggist and preacher, but he was alerted by neighbours before it could detonate.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Suspected Islamists have attacked a police station in northern Nigeria with explosives ahead of Saturdays parliamentary vote, injuring two police officers.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Gunmen shot dead four people in northeastern Nigeria, including a ruling party official, as they prepared to distribute election materials on Friday. The attack happened at a police station in Shani in Borno state and the victims included the local government secretary of the ruling Peoples Democratic Party.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Three bomb blasts have hit a city in northeastern Nigeria, leaving a number of people killed and wounded in an attack believed to have been carried out by Islamist sect, Boko Haram. Two blasts occurred at a hotel tavern in the city. At least three killed and eight wounded.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Police in Maiduguri reported a fresh explosion Monday morning when a bomb was tossed at one of its patrol vans by attackers on a motorcycle, leaving one policeman wounded.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Two motorcycle-riding gunmen opened fire late Thursday on local chief, Abba Mukhtar, outside his home in Maiduguri, killing him and seriously injuring his friend.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: An explosive device killed two pedestrians in the Nigerian city of Maiduguri. Police have blamed the Islamist sect known as Boko Haram. The explosive device may have been intended to target a joint police and military patrol, but detonated when disturbed by civilian pedestrians.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: A bomb targeting a military patrol exploded in northeastern Nigeria on Monday, causing damage to a vehicle but no injuries. Three arrests were made in connection to the attack. Police suspected Boko Haram.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Suspected members of Nigerian Islamist sect, Boko Haram, have killed the brother of an influential west African spiritual leader based in the country's northeast. Abba-Anas Umar Garbai was shot by gunmen outside his home in the city of Maiduguri. Garbai is the younger brother of the Shehu of Borno, the most prominent traditional and Islamic spiritual leader in northeastern Nigeria, whose influence extends across the border into parts of neighbouring Cameroon, Chad and Niger Republic.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Suspected extremists hurled bombs at a child vaccine warehouse in the restive city of Maiduguri in northeastern Nigeria. Three cars in the parking lot were also burnt in the attack. No casualties were recorded in the attack that took place overnight.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Suspected Boko Haram sect members threw bombs at a government office in Maiduguri. The explosive did not penetrate the premises. No report of casualties.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Suspected Boko Haram extremists set off four explosions at Gwange police station in Maiduguri. Police engaged the attackers in a fire fight, killing three.

notes: Suspected Boko Haram extremists set off an explosion at a Catholic church in Maiduguri. Two passers-by were killed and a third injured.

notes: Police in northeast Nigeria's Borno state have repelled an attack on a police post by suspected Islamists, killing one and arresting 11 others.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: A suicide bomber drove a bomb laden car into a Catholic church in suburban Jos killing at least 14, including himself. 22 injured. Following the blast a gunman shot dead three civilians. A conflicting report has seven dead.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Unidentified gunmen threw explosives at a police patrol, killing a police officer, a soldier and a civilian.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram gunmen attacked the residence of former Chairman of Kukawa Local Council of Borno State, Alhaji Bukar Abacha, shooting him dead before his wife and children in Fezzan Ward of Maiduguri.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram gunmen shot and wound two police officers.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Following a five hour gunfight security forces shot dead nine gunmen believed to be involved in several previous attacks.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram gunmen blow up a remote bank with a homemade bomb. Later, the group was chased to northern Kano State where nine died in a shootout with police.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: A Boko Haram school bomb kills two civilians, including an Islamic scholar.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: A gun battle kills five suspected Boko Haram members.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: During a military raid on their Kano hideout members of Boko Haram detonate a car bomb in defense, killing two sect members and injuring two soldiers.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Gun battles renew into Sunday, three police and three sect members killed.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Military forces launch a pre-dawn operation on a Boko Haram hideout. There were an "undisclosed" number of rebel deaths.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Gunmen suspected to be members of Boko Haram killed two civilians.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram bombs a police station and a military headquarters in Damagum, four police killed.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Police conduct a house-to-house search for Boko Haram members, kill four in a gun battle. The group was wanted for suspected for involvement for killing a prison official and a retired inspector of police.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: A group of Boko Haram members attack a local police station. Four killed in their effort.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
notes: Security forces kill 11 Boko Haram members (actor not confirmed) over a shootout near a bomb factory that lasted two days. One soldier and one police member were also killed.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
notes: A battle between Boko Haram (actor not confirmed) and security forces enters its second day.

actor1: Police Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Police arrest 33 members of Boko Haram near the state capital, though Boko Haram denies this occurred.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: A suicide bomber injures two.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Two civilians are killed by Boko Haram in the Panshekara neighbourhood and another in a separate location near Zaria road.

actor1: Police Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: A police officer is killed by Boko Haram in the Barkin Ladi area.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Two members of Boko Haram are killed in an internal dispute.

actor1: Police Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: A security detail kills two members of Boko Haram in a shootout. A senior police officer is killed else ware in the city in a separate event.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Three members of Boko Haram are killed when they arose suspicion at a checkpoint.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram gunmen kill seven civilian traders at a market.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram (believed) detonates a bomb in central Jos, but caused no death.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram detonates two explosives outside a church during Easter services, 41 dead, many others hurt.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram attackers kill a civilian, a politician and a police officer before being shot and killed by the military.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: A security team in pursuit of those involved in an attack on a market on March 4th kill three and arrest others.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Movement of forces: More than 100 Boko Haram fighters have entered Gao following the Tuareg victory.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Suspected Boko Haram gunmen kill a young girl and three others.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Suspected members of Islamist group Boko Haram have killed at least five people and burnt immigration offices in a Nigerian town on the border with Cameroon.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: On 10 April 2012, Boko Haram fighters attacked the border town Banki (Mayo-Sava, Extreme-Nord), killing 15 Nigerians (no Cameroon nationals were victims). The Cameroonian government responded with more security placed along the border of the two nations.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: The JTF foils a bomb attack when they find a series of large undetonated ordinances.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram shoots and kills ten civilians at a border town with Cameroon.

actor1: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-)
notes: Movement of forces: The Cameroonian military increases their presence along the border with Nigeria (opposite Banki) following a Boko Haram attack April 10th along the border (in Nigeria)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
notes: Gunmen, presumed to be the same group that yesterday attacked a market, torched two schools. So far 14 schools have been burnt down by Boko Haram, 7,000 children affected - enrollment down 28% in Borno State.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram spokesman, Abu Qaqa II, is killed in an internal Boko Haram struggle. Exact date and place (likely in Borno State) of the event are unknown.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: A JTF task force raids a Boko Haram hideout, kills four and makes 13 arrests.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Suspected members of Boko Haram attack customers of a bakery, five dead. Police kill one sect member was he tried to escape. This happened in the Polo neighbourhood of the city.

actor1: Government of Nigeria (1999-2015)
notes: The government of Nigeria announces they have opened a Boko Haram interrogation and detention center in Lagos.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: A photographer at Sharada Kwanar Ganduje area in Kano was shot dead by unidentified gunmen, suspected to be members of the Boko Haram militants.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: A Spanish doctor who was kidnapped on April 4th is released unharmed.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Nigerian Forces have shot dead two suspected Boko Haram members who allegedly attacked and killed five bakery workers last week.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: During a JTF raid on a Boko Haram bomb factory a explosive is inadvertently detonated, killing five BH suspects.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram is blamed for an attack on a bar that killed five, including a politician.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Police arrest a suspected Boko Haram suicide before he was to carry out his objective on a Methodist church.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
notes: Attackers attack two police stations, causalities uncertain. It is unclear if the attackers were Boko Haram or armed robbers.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
notes: Armed attackers, believed to be the same group as those in the same town a day before, attack a bank. Police suspect Boko Haram, but the group could be a band of robbers.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram launched an attack on the home of a retired civil servant, five dead. Police respond and kill two of the assailants.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram launched an attack on a beer parlour killing five and injuring six others.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Following two morning attacks a third is detonated in the Ungwan Muazu area of the state. Two injured.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Suicide bombers in the Nigerian capital Abuja detonated their ordinance in a newspaper office. 37 killed, 100 injured. Conflicting reports on the number of deaths, many have the number as low a 10. Boko Haram later claimed responsibility, threatening further attacks on media offices around the country.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: A suicide bomber hits a second newspaper officer in Kaduna, three killed. The two blasts came minutes apart. A third blast came two hours later and killed four more civilians.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram gunmen open fire on a Sunday church service and kill four worshippers.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: A bomb and gun attack on a theatre used for Sunday church services at a university has left at least 19 people dead.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Suspected Boko Haram shoot and kill four traders in Yobe State.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Suspected Boko Haram gunmen attack cattle trading market for the second time in a week. At least 50 reported dead, but the number was expected to climb.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
notes: A journalists home is attacked after an unfavorable article is published. The assailants are unknown, but the victim is certain it was not Boko Haram.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Gunmen believed to be from radical Islamist sect kill 2 guards in a prison break, free 23 prisoners.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Suspected Boko Haram attack police guards at a wedding party, kill three attendees. Later in the day there was a bomb blast that injured four women and two children in the same area.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
notes: Police engage in a four hour gunfight with unknowns, possible Boko Haram. Nine gunmen killed.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Three people were on Sunday night killed when gunmen opened fire on residents of Tukuntawa area of Kano.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Attacks in north-east Nigeria believed to have been carried out by radical Islamist sect Boko Haram killed at least seven police officers. The attack also struck the home of a former senator.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
notes: A bus explosion rocked an area of the Nigerian oil hub city of Port Harcourt on Thursday, a military spokesman said, but the cause and extent of damage remained unclear, though a school is believed to have been destroyed. Boko Haram suspected. Two killed, others injured.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: A local political official receives several threats via text message from a militant group, suspected to be Boko Haram. The messages were alerting the officials of plans to bomb the police station in the town, the Otukpo Main Market and St Marys Church, among others.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: An explosive thrown by suspected members of Islamist Boko Haram sect on at patrolling soldiers damaged some houses in a city.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
notes: Suspected Boko Haram gunmen shot dead four card players in the northern Nigerian city of Kano. Motivation unknown.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Gunmen killed a Muslim cleric and a retired prison guard on Saturday in northeastern Nigeria, residents and a medic said, amid a wave of such killings blamed on Islamist group Boko Haram.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
notes: Gunmen opened fire on Muslim worshippers outside the home of a controversial cleric in Nigeria on Sunday, killing at least one person and wounding others. Boko Haram is suspected as the cleric had recently been critical of the group.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
notes: Gunmen on a motorcycle shot dead six traders from the mainly Christian Igbo ethnic group in northeastern Nigeria. Boko Haram are active in the area, though it is unclear who is behind these attacks.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Armed bandits suspected to be members of radical Islamic sect Boko Haram killed 10 people as they attacked a bakery on the outskirts of Maiduguri town in Nigeria today, witnesses said. Residents say the attackers came in the wee hours of the morning and killed mostly Christian workers of the bakery, then took an unknown amount of money as they left.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Two civilians are killed by suspected Boko Haram at Abaganaram market.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: A German, Raupach Edgar, and four others were killed in Kano, during a shootout between military men of the Joint Task Force (JTF) and the dreaded sect, Boko Haram.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Three are killed in a hotel bar at the hands of suspected Boko Haram.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: At people were killed and 40 or more injured when a suicide bomber attacked a church. Boko Haram claimed responsibility in the days that followed. Conflicting accounts have the death toll at nine and injured number at 35, while others have the toll at three.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
notes: Following a Boko Haram suicide bombing, military forces allegedly shoot and kill eight bombing victims and wound others in an apparent effort to restore law and order in the blast area.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Forces shot dead 16 militants in a fire fight with Islamist sect Boko Haram. A Reuters reporter heard gunfire and explosions echoing through the remote city of Maiduguri.

actor1: Police Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Gunmen suspected to belong to Boko Haram opened fire and killed a retired deputy inspector-general of Nigeria's federal police, as well as two other officers in the city.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: A suicide car-bomber, widely believed to be involved in Boko Haram, hit the main gate of the Borno State Police Command Headquarters in Maiduguri, killing a Police inspector, a traffic warden and four other civilians, injuring 24 tricycles drivers and passengers commuting on the Airport Road when the blast occurred at 11.26am. Eight killed, 24 injured. Some reports have the death count seven, while others, eight. Earlier in the day another suicide bomber detonated himself near a school elsewhere in the city.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Three Boko Haram gunmen enter a church and open fire on congregants. At least one dead.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: A man drove a bomb-laden car to the entrance of the Christ Chosen Church and detonated it. At least six deaths reported, including the bomber, 52 injured, but number may rise. Boko Haram later declared responsibility.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Two policemen have been killed and three others wounded in an attack allegedly carried out by Boko Haram. The gunmen were able to flee the scene.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Nigeria's Joint Security Task Force (JTF) on killed four suspected militants and arrested seven others during a raid at Naibawa Kwanar Masallaci quarters in the West African country's northwestern state of Kano.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Four are dead in a Boko Haram Christian church bombing in a town known as Trikaniya.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram bombs Ekilisiya Yanuwaa Nigeria (EYN) Church, three worshipers killed, 54 injured.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Coordinated suicide blasts cause damage at a Christian church in Ungwan Baraawa. (Conflicting account: some reports claim there were only three churches bombed, which does not include this event).

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Coordinated suicide blasts cause damage at a Christian church in Nassarawa. (Conflicting account: some reports claim there were only three churches bombed, which does not include this event).

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram (who later takes responsibility) suicide bombs two church during Sunday services. The blasts happened in the Wusasa and Sabon-Gari districts of Zaria. 22 believed dead.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram suicide bombers hit a churches during Sunday services, driving a explosive laden car into the building. Boko Haram claimed responsibility in the days that followed. Authorities in Kaduna State impose a 24 hour curfew following the violence. 23 dead, plus injuries. Some reports have the death toll as high as 40. 75 were killed in the total church bombings plus retaliation through rioting.

actor1: Rioters (Nigeria)
notes: Following a series of Boko Haram church blasts Christians are incensed, set up road blocks in suburban Kaduna.

actor1: Rioters (Nigeria)
notes: Rioting violence erupted late in the day following Boko Haram attacks on Sunday. Much of the violence lasted until Tuesday.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Day two a Boko Haram attacks on Damaturu. Three police officers killed, four others injured.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Violence renews in Kano City, explosions and shootings at police vehicles are reported in the evening. At least three police officers killed when they are slain by their own stolen weapons.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Attackers with guns and explosives raided a jail in a restive Nigerian city on Sunday, leaving four Prison Guards dead and freeing 40 inmates. Boko Haram is blamed. The gunmen also attacked a school in the town.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
notes: An explosion near a cluster of bars in the northern Nigerian city of Bauchi, recently targeted by Boko Haram Islamists, has injured nine people. No group has claimed responsibility for this blast, but Boko Haram is suspected.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
notes: Gunmen with explosives attacked a police station on Tuesday in the northern Nigerian city of Kano, previously targeted by Islamist militant group Boko Haram. The clash lasted into a second day, resulting in the death of seventeen militants and one police officer.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Day two of attacks on a police station by suspected Boko Haram. Seventeen militants and one police officer killed by the end of the battle. Several arrested.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Gunmen suspected to be Boko Haram attack a police station and a bank in a small town. "Many lives" were said to have been lost in the attack.

actor1: Police Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Police say security forces have killed suspected sect members during a military raid on their hideout in a besieged city in Nigeria's northeast. The police were not clear with regard to the number of deceased.

actor1: Police Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Gunfire and explosions rocked the northeastern Nigerian city of Damaturu on Saturday as security forces launched a pre-emptive offensive against Boko Haram Islamists. The offensive followed intelligence that BH was planning to launch an attack on the city. The violence was most heavily concentrated in the Nyanya and Obasanjo Estates areas of the city.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Military forces shoot and kill three suspected Boko Haram members. One female was arrested.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram attackers killed nine construction workers in the restive northeastern city of Maiduguri, the base of the Islamist sect.

actor1: Protesters (Nigeria)
notes: Members of the military gathered at the Gowon House headquarters of the National Youth Service Corps (NYSC) in Abuja, seeking immediate redeployment from the northern states over fears of Boko Haram attacks.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Suspected gunmen believed to be members of the Boko Haram sect attacked the Borno State Housing Corporation (BOHC) office complex in Maiduguri, killing its General Manager, Isa Madu Ngaram and an engineer.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Suspected Boko Haram attack a Damaturu slum with explosives and firearms. Causalities and damage unknown.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Military forces raid a Boko Haram hideout, kill one member of the sect.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
notes: Defusal: Police discover and detonate a pair of explosives in the Congo Russia neighborhood of the city. It is unknown who the perpetrators are, however, the police force publically blamed Boko Haram.

actor1: Fulani Ethnic Militia (Nigeria)
notes: Fulani militants (and/or Boko Haram) raid six villages in the Barakin Ladi region (villages either unincorporated or not named) and kill at least 63. Most of the victims were found at the home of a Christian pastor, where the large group was gathered for safety. More than 200 displaced among the villages.

actor1: Fulani Ethnic Militia (Nigeria)
notes: Fulani militants (and/or Boko Haram) raid several villages in the Riyom government area causing numerous deaths. Specific villages were not named. 58 were killed among to two areas. More than 200 displaced among the villages.

actor1: Fulani Ethnic Militia (Nigeria)
notes: Muslim Fulani herdsmen (and/or Boko Haram) raided several villages. Here, a cemetery in Barkin Ladis area known as Maseh, at least 22 were killed in a raid, including two politicians. Most of the victims are of the Christian Birom ethnic group. The group was at the cemetery to bury the victims of the previous days attacks in the area. More than 200 people displaced among the villages. Later the Fulanis blame the military for the attacks.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Suspected members of Boko Haram attacked the residence of an Islamic cleric, Shehu of Borno, Alhaji Abubakar Umar Garbai El-Kanem, killing a resident of the palace as well as a trader in a nearby market.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Suspected members of Boko Haram attack and kill an Islamic cleric, Sheikh Ibrahim Majimi, at his home.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: A suicide bomber kills 10 in a Mosque near the Shehus palace. The Shehu is the top Islamic leader in the state. Six others injured. The bomber was a teenage boy, whom security experts believe was involved with Boko Haram.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Gunmen, suspected to be Boko Haram, attack a small town outside Kaduna, kill one.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
notes: A bomb is detonated in a car outside a church during Sunday services, no causalities. Police arrest two suspects following the incident, who are believed to be involved in Boko Haram (not confirmed).

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Heavy gunfire reported in the Yobe State capital. Suspected Boko Haram members raid a police station. The organization later claims credit for the attack.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
notes: An explosion outside a government building kills at least one. It is unknown is perpetrated the incident, though it is believed to be either Boko Haram or a Fulani group.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Gunmen, suspected to be of Boko Haram, target Ibo Christians in an open air market and kill four.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Six are dead, including a police constable when gunmen on motorcycles attack a market area. Boko Haram is widely believed to be responsible.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Gunmen, suspected to be linked to Boko Haram attack a radio station and kill three. Sharada is a Kano neighbourhood south east of the downtown area.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram attacks a JTF team along a road. Unknown causalities.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram kills a 10-yesr-old boy and wounds 10 others. The explosion occurred in the city's Tundunwadan Dan-iya area, a nightlife and pub district, a common target of Boko Haram, who later clamed credit for the blast.

actor1: Police Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad

notes: At least 15 separate explosions in targeting JTF forces punctuated by gunfire echoed Monday across a Maiduguri city, leaving more than 10 persons dead and telecommunication masts burnt. actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad

notes: An explosive device targeting a military patrol went off on a road in Nigeria's northeastern city of Potiskum, setting the vehicle on fire. There were at least six soldiers on board the car, but their status is unclear. A nearby market was affected by the blast as well.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: The headmaster of Ari Primary School, Musa Magazai and one Mallam Galtamari, along with his two children, were killed in the early hours by gunmen suspected to be members of the Boko Haram sect. actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Suspected Boko Haram gunmen attack the home of a man and set him ablaze.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Gunmen, suspected to be Boko Haram, kill the son of a political figure.

notes: A suicide bomber rammed an SUV loaded with explosives into a Catholic church holding Mass on Sunday in northern Nigeria, killing at eight fifteen people and wounding 145 others. Some witnesses said the death toll could be as high as 12. They said the dead included children. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack. Christian youths retaliated against a group of Muslims following the blast, believing Boko Haram, or another Islamic group responsible. The death toll grew as the day wore on.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Gunmen, suspected to be Boko Haram, invade a small town, torch a police station and a Christian/religious primary school. The attack began in the early evening, so it is not clear if civilians were present in the school. Causalities not reported.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Gunmen, suspected to be Boko Haram, invade a small town, torch a police station and a primary school. Causalities not reported.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Harem gunmen shoot and kill the chairman of and ANPP and a prominent businessman near their residential neighbourhood.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
notes: Soldiers systematically shot and killed more than 40 civilians in the Kalari neighborhood, believing they had connections to Boko Haram. Dozens of men were forced from their homes in house to house searches in Maiduguri and marched to an open field where their faces were compared to photographic databases. Some were separated and then shot. Reports said 48 died, others 39, still others 70. In October, soldiers shot dead more than 30 civilians and burned homes in Maiduguri after a bomb suspected to have been planted by the sect killed a lieutenant. Following the attacks soldiers occupied the Kalari area of the city.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Suspected Boko Haram gunmen set fire to several government buildings and over 20 houses, three reported killed.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Suspected Boko Haram kill three outside a house. "The three gunmen came on a motorcycle and opened fire on their victims who had just parked outside a house," Kano state police spokesman Mustapha Abubakar told AFP.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Suspected Boko Haram gunmen attacked a police station, set fire to a primary school and destroyed several cell phone towers in the early morning hours. Witnesses saw the bodies of two police officers being carried out of the police station, though this was not substantiated.

notes: A suspected Boko Haram member detonates a suicide car bomb near a church, claims eight lives plus injuries.

notes: Following a battle between Boko Haram and the JTF, a leader of and ANPP is shot and killed in his area residence by a suspected member of the militant organization.

notes: A school teacher and two others were yesterday murdered by gunmen suspected to be Boko Haram members. The gunmen, according to a resident, sneaked into the residence of the school teacher, who worked a private school in the area.

notes: Suspected Boko Haram members have killed a District Head of Dusuma Ward of Jere Local Government Area of Borno State, Kazalla Ali, and his son, after a late night attack on their home.

notes: Fourteen persons, including a Divisional Police Officer (DPO) were killed in Potiskum during a crossfire between members of the Boko Haram sect and security officials. Three of the deceased are civilians who caught in the crossfire. An unconfirmed report also has it that the suspected militants made attempt to attack the palace of the Emir of Fika within the town, Alhaji Mohammed Idrissa Ibn Abale, but were repelled by men of the Joint Task Force (JTF) stationed in the palace. At attack began at 2 am with the bombing of a police station.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Suspected Boko Haram gunmen attacked and killed a retired soldier. The former soldier, Mohmmed Bulama, was followed by two gunmen then shot in his residence at Ruwan Zafi ward of the metropolis.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Gunmen suspected to be members of the Boko Haram sect yesterday ambushed some soldiers guarding a telecommunication mast and a primary school along Chezcon area in the Bolori ward of the Maiduguri metro. One soldier killed.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Suspected Boko Haram gunmen stormed into a Maiduguri market, shot and killed and trader, wounded two others.

notes: Gunmen have bombed and attacked a police station and kidnapped a Frenchman, Mr Francis Colump in Rimi Local Government area of Katsina State. A Boko Haram splinter group, Ansaru, later claims responsibility. Two reported deaths.

notes: Two suicide car bombers attacked the facilities of two mobile phone operators in Kano, killing themselves and maiming at least one person. The attack on the Airtel office, located opposite Malam Kato Square military cenotaph and overlooking Central Bank office in the state, occurred around 8:45am. Less than one hour after the first blast, another explosion went off at an MTN switch station opposite Northern Flour Mills along Maimalari Road in Bompai industrial area, about 500 metres from the state police command, killing only the bomber. Authorities did not speculate as to the identity or group affiliation of the perpetrators, though Boko Haram have demonstrated similar behaviour in the area.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad

notes: Hundreds of women took to the streets of Maiduguri near Ramat Square calling for the immediate release of their kin, who were arrested and kept in custody of the Joint Task Force (JTF) for months over Boko Haram related crimes. Police fired into the air to disperse the crowd.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Gunmen suspected to be Boko Haram shot and killed nine female health care workers during a Polio immunization exercise at two locations in the city. Authorities later arrest and charge three radio journalists for "sparking" the killings. Police claimed their on-air comments about a vaccination campaign in the area inflamed the region and caused the attacks.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram gunmen attacked the premises of the Nigerian Flour Mills in Maiduguri and kidnapped its Administrative Manager, Malam Umar Baba Mai Salati, at gunpoint and whisked him away in his vehicle to unknown destination. The armed kidnappers, according to an eyewitness, were three in number. They pretended, at the Flour Mills gate, as if they were waiting for someone, before forcefully whisking Salati away. The reasons for the abduction is unknown.

notes: A major gun battle broke out Friday along the coast of Lake Chad, in north-eastern Nigeria, where troops clashed with Boko Haram fighters into Sunday, forcing civilians to flee into the surrounding brush lands. The majority of the causalities (185, plus injuries; 30 of whom were attributed Boko Haram) were civilian bystanders. Security forces arrest several members of Boko Haram following the clash. Conflicting account: The military said residents claims that 185 people were killed during the attack were false.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: A group of 200 Boko Haram fighters launched an attack on a military battalion barracks in Bama. Ten members of Boko Haram and two soldiers killed in the exchange. Boko Haram also attacked a nearby police station killing 22 police officers, 14 prison officials and three civilians. It is not clear if the civilians were specifically targeted, or if they were victims of cross fire. 105 prisoners were freed as a result of the attack on the police post. Leadership reports for the deaths of 55, though only 41 were specifically accounted for. It was later revealed by Boko Haram that they had kidnapped several "women and children" during the attack.

notes: Military Forces attack several Boko Haram bases with heavy weapons within Sambisa Game Reserve over the course of two days. Between 21 and 35 reported dead from the shelling and air strikes. The assaults follow the deployment of 2,000+ troops in Borno in the aftermath of a presidential proclamation declaring a state of emergency in the area.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: An explosive detonated in the Kasuwan Shanu areas at about 6.45 am, killing two persons and injuring two others.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Military forces stop a Boko Haram offensive in Maiduguri. Areas affected include north, northeast and southeast flanks of Maiduguri metropolis, including three housing estates on Bama and Gambouru/Ngala roads. Fourteen Boko Haram, three soldiers dead, 65 arrested. Military forces implement a 24-hour curfew following the attacks.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Due to a troop offensive the military has captured the following Borno State towns from Boko Haram since 05/14: New Marte, Kirenuwa, Zabamari, Zambiza Forest, Mafa, Baga, Bama, Banki, Woloji, Gulumba, Gamboru-Ngala, Damasak, Malam Fatori, Abadam, Gashigar, Kukawa, Monguno, Hausari. An air assault blanketed much of the area. The extent of fighting in each location is unclear. In several cases the number of forces deployed to the area has caused Boko Haram elements to flee.

notes: Arrests: Security forces arrest 120 suspected members of Boko Haram during a funeral service for one of their leaders.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram gunmen shot and killed a shop owner and his son in Chescon area for unknown reason. It is believed the father was targeted, his son was killed by a stray bullet.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram shoots and kills a security official of the Department of State Security Services (SSS) in Ajilari/Gomari airport ward of Maiduguri on the evening of 24/05. The gunmen arrived at the scene with AK-47 hidden in their clothes before they fired then fled the scene.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Government forces overtake three Boko Haram camps within the Sambisa Forces Reserve, rescue three women and six children they had previously taken hostage in an attack on Bama earlier in the month.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Security forces kill three suspected members of Boko Haram and arrest 25 during a raid on their hideout.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: A lieutenant of a Boko Haram leader Abubakar Shekau is discovered dead in the Lake Chad area by police. It is not clear if he was victim of a government military offensive, or Boko Haram infighting.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Suspected Boko Haram gunmen kill the District Head of Dala Alamderi Ward in front of his wife and children.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Suspected Boko Haram attacked the villages of Hrazah and Hembe in Gwoza, killing a district head and burning two churches.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram attacked Niamey prison and attacked Salafis prisoners. Niger troops surrounded the prison and a clash ensued. 3 died, 3 prison guards injured.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Gunmen suspected to be Boko Haram kidnapped the father of the Borno State Commissioner for Women Affairs, Hajiya Inna Galadima, Alhaji Galadima. It is not clear if the kidnapping was expressly political.

actor1: Protesters (Nigeria)
notes: Igbo youths under the aegis of Association of Igbo Youths Organisation, AIYO, stormed Anambra State House of Assembly to protest the directive by MASSOB ordering everybody should stay at home on June 8, a protest against a recent Boko Haram killing.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Military forces shot and killed eight members of Boko Haram in Maiduguri.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: A suspected Boko Haram explosive at a church is discovered by police and dismantled before it was allowed to detonate.

actor1: Unidentified Communal Militia (Nigeria)
actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram kills 13 members of a youth vigilante group opposed to the sect. The vigilante group typically provides information against Boko Haram to security forces. The Boko Haram members were able to move past security checkpoints to the location of the group by hiding weapons in a coffin they were carrying. Later report account for 19 deaths.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: A vigilante group headed or inspired by Ali Kwara delivers 60 corpses of Boko Haram members to security forces. The details of each of the deaths are not given.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram launches an attack against a border town, burning buildings. Causalities reported, but exact numbers are vague. Precise date unknown.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Members of Boko Haram attack the villages of Hwaa, Kunde, Gathahure and Gjigga in the Gwoza area torching four churches with Improvised Explosives Devices (IEDS) and petro-bombs. At least two deaths, including a clergyman.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Three soldiers are critically wounded in a Boko Haram attack.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Seven students, two teachers and two insurgents were killed when suspected members of Nigerian Islamist sect Boko Haram attacked a school in the north-eastern town of Damaturu, the military said. The death of the Boko Haram members comes at the hands of a local vigilante group following the school attack .

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Seven students, two teachers and two insurgents were killed when suspected members of Nigerian Islamist sect Boko Haram attacked a school in the north-eastern town of Damaturu, the military said. The death of the Boko Haram members comes at the hands of a local vigilante group following the school attack .

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram overruns a farming village near Maiduguris Alau Dam, killing 13 fishermen and tea vendors. The motive for the attack is unknown. Other sources hold twenty deaths.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Nine students are killed by Boko Haram gunmen as they sat taking an exam. The attack occurred at the Ansarudeen School, in the Jajeri suburb of the city. Boko Haram said the attack was to punish the students for helping the army.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram strike against a second school in two days, killing four teachers and two students. This attack occurred in the Customs area of the city.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram attacks Limankara village, killing "scores" of people, including the pastor a local church. The attackers were fleeing from an ongoing offensive by the military in area when they entered the village.

actor1: Unidentified Communal Militia (Nigeria)
actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Arrests: Members of a vigilante group apprehend 31 Boko Haram suspects in the Bulabulin, Anguwan Doki, Shuwari and Gamboru Market areas of Maiduguri.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: 22 suspected members of Boko Haram and two members of security forces are killed in a gun battle in Mainok.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Suspected Boko Haram gunmen kill a soldier and abducted three others during an attack in Potiskum.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: After an attack on military forces in Fune LGA, the JTF recovered two vehicles, arms, ammunition and other materials from their Boko Haram attackers. No causalities reported.

actor1: Unidentified Communal Militia (Nigeria)
actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Arrests: Members of a youth vigilante group arrest four members of Boko Haram in Galtimari Ward, including a top commander, Abubakar Shekau.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram renews attacks on communities of the Gwoza, killing 15. The villages attacked were Gathahure, Hwaa, Tihezeh, Hrazah, Hembe and Gjigga.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Military members conduct a seek and destroy mission against Boko Haram in the Zabarmari area of Borno, 10 kilometres (six miles) from the city of Maiduguri. 10 BH deaths reported in a shootout.

actor1: Police Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
notes: 175 inmates of Olokuta Medium Prison are freed when gunmen attacked the facility during the overnight hours. Boko Haram has in the past orchestrated prison breaks, but it not clear who is responsible here. No causalities reported. 49 inmates were later recovered by security forces.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Military forces kill and additional 40 members of Boko Haram in the Zabarmari area of Borno a day after the initial battle.

actor1: Rioters (Nigeria)
notes: A vigilante militia sets fire a ANPP politicians home, Mala Othman, a local sheriff, believing he is colluding in Boko Haram. Following the arson, nearby soldiers fired into the air and scared the group off. It was later learned Othman was not home at the time of the incident.

actor1: BVYG: Borno Vigilance Youths Group
actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Members of the BVYG, a recently formed vigilante group, clashed with Boko Haram causing an "unspecified number of deaths".

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Military forces gunned down three suspected Boko Haram members disguised as women while 20 others who also dressed like women were arrested while attempting to attack the Ibrahim Taiwo Police Station along Baga road.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram attacks a Christian boarding school, burning 30 to death as they slept in a dormitory. Later reports have the causality total at 42 (Vanguard).

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: One Boko Haram commander is reported dead and other arrested in a military raid in Gidan-Dare, outside Sokoto. Twelve explosives recovered.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Military forces raid a Boko Haram hideout, free several hostages, and cause unnumbered causalities. The raid took place in the Bulabulin Nganaram area of the city.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: The Joint Task Force (JTF), Operation Restore Order and members of Borno Vigilance Youths Group (BVYG), killed 30 members of Boko Haram at the Zagardajeri village of Jere Local Council of the state during a raid.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: The Joint Task Force (military) kills three Boko Haram members in Jigawa State and recovered their weapons in a pre-dawn raid at Guri Local Government Area of the state.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Arrests: Military Forces and the BVYG capture a top Boko Haram commander known only at "Two Face" in Hausari and Lawan Bukar wards.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Three suspected Boko Haram members attacked the El-Amin Daggash Mosque in Maiduguri, with the intention of killing Islamic cleric, Modu Mustapha. Worshippers, however, reacted by lynching the assailants until death.

notes: Military forces with assistance from a civilian militia raid a Boko Haram hideout, kill seven and recover weapons.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Two teenagers and a police officer are dead after gunmen, suspected to be Boko Haram, attacked the home of a prominent cleric.

actor1: BVYG: Borno Vigilance Youths Group

notes: Borno Vigilance Youths Group attack a Boko Haram member, burning him alive.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram launched reprisal attacks over two consecutive days on Mainok killing 23 civilians. The attacks were a response to harassment by the Civilian JTF or BVYG: Borno Vigilance Youths Group. Similar attacks occurred in Dawashe (Dawashi).

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram launched reprisal attacks over two consecutive days on Mainok killing 23 civilians. The attacks were a response to harassment by the Civilian JTF or BVYG: Borno Vigilance Youths Group. Similar attacks occurred in Dawashe (Dawashi).

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram attacks the location known as Dawashe (Dawashi) in Borno State, causing 25 deaths, 20 of which were civilian. The sect attacked the village after an anti-Boko Haram vigilante group known as the Civilian JTF or BVYG: Borno Vigilance Youths Group launched an attack against them. The violence in the town is in apparent retaliation.

actor1: BVYG: Borno Vigilance Youths Group

The violence in the town is in apparent retaliation.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Suspected Boko Haram gunmen stormed a construction site in northeast Nigeria, carting off 125 kg (275 pounds) of dynamite and hundreds of detonators.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Several large blasts followed by gunfire target a church and several drinking establishments in Kanos Sabon Gari neighbourhood. Six are killed initially and six others injured. In the following days a total of 45 people succumbed to their injuries. Boko Haram is believed to be responsible.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Military forces claim to have killed Boko Hamem leader Abubakar Shekau in a gun battle in the northeast, near the border with Cameroon. His death at the time of the announcement was not independently verified.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram attacked and killed eight people in an attack targeting teachers and Muslim clerics in Bui town, 185 kilometres (115 miles) south of Maiduguri.

actor1: BVYG: Borno Vigilance Youths Group
notes: Five people were killed when volunteer youth vigilante group, also known as "Civilian JTF" or BVYG, from Maiduguri clashed with their counterpart in Biu town, 185 kilometres south of the state capital. A witness said trouble started when the group from Maiduguri, backed by operatives of the Joint Task Force, JTF, stormed Biu in order to capture some fleeing Boko Haram militants who had allegedly relocated to the town.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram launched two attacks in Borno state on Sunday -- one against a police base in the town of Bama, the other against a multinational Joint Task Force station in the town of Malam Fatori (Bisagana). The clash in Malam Fatori (Bisagana) led to the death of two soldiers and 15 militants.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram launched two attacks in Borno state on Sunday -- one against a police base in the town of Bama, the other against a multinational Joint Task Force station in the town of Malam Fatori (Bisagana). The gun battle in Bama led to the death of one policeman and 17 Boko Haram militants, including Momodu Bama and Abubakar Shekau, both notable leaders. Two soldiers were wounded, others missing.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)

notes: Suspected members of Boko Haram stormed a roadblock mounted by the Joint Military Task Force in Yobe State and killed four soldiers and two policemen.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)

notes: Security Measures: Nigeria's military says it declared an all-day curfew and conducted house to house searches amid fears Boko Haram, armed with explosives infiltrated the north-eastern Yobe state capital of Potiskum. No report of clashes or attacks.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: At least 60 are dead after attacks by Boko Haram in the Local Government Areas of Ngom, Maisarmari and Mailari in Konduga and Mafa of Borno State. The attacks occurred over the course of two days.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Arrests: Security forces claim to have captured 1,000 members Boko Haram in Borno and Yobe States over the course of three months.

notes: At least 60 are dead after attacks by Boko Haram in the Local Government Areas of Ngom, Maisarmari and Mailari in Konduga and Mafa of Borno State. The attacks occurred over the course of two days.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Suspected Boko Haram members shoot dead 44 worshippers in a mosque.

actor1: Police Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Suspected members of Boko Haram open fire on a group of police and civilians killing a total of 13. It is not clear if the perpetrators targeted one group over the other.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Suspected members of Boko Haram open fire on a group of police and civilians killing a total of 13. It is not clear if the perpetrators targeted one group over the other.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Seven members of Boko Haram are killed in a two-hour gun fight early in the day.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Military forces arrest 17 Boko Haram members following a shoot-out in Gamboru Ngala, a town near the border with Cameroon.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Suspected Boko Haram attack Dumba village, near Baga, killing 44 villagers as they left a mosque, slitting their throats and gouging out their eyes on the grounds that they refused to cooperate with them. Additionally, an estimated 4,000 people were displaced as a result of the attack.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: The Joint Task Force (JTF) and members of the Borno Vigilance Youth Group (BVYG) kill four terror suspects in Zajeri and Bolori wards of Maiduguri metropolis, while two rifles and ammunition were recovered from their houses.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Suspected Islamist extremists dressed as soldiers opened fire on residents of a Fulani town in the northeast after luring them out of their homes, killing four civilians and two police officers. The attack appeared to be in reprisal for the recent arrests of Boko Haram members. The attack occurred in the town of Gamboru Ngala near the border with Cameroon. It is not clear if the intended target of the attackers was the police or civilians.

actor1: Police Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Suspected Boko Harem gunmen attack a police station in Gwoza cost the lives of two police and seven attackers.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram shoots and kills six villagers in Damasak as they slept.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram attacks Agbena and Agbaaga villages of Borikyo ward in Ukum Local Government area, killing 18. The motivation for the attack is not known.

actor1: Unidentified Communal Militia (Nigeria)
actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Posing as members of the military, Boko Haram entered Bama, gathered members of a local vigilante group, and shot them. The killings are likely a form of revenge against local Boko Haram push back. Varying sources hold different causality accounts.

actor1: BVYG: Borno Vigilance Youths Group
actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Six members of the youth vigilante group, popularly called Civilian JTF or BVYG in Borno State, were shot dead by suspected members of Boko Haram in the border town of Damasak, Mobar Local Government Area of the state.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Seventeen civilians are killed by Boko Haram when they came to the aid of the BVYG.

actor1: BVYG: Borno Vigilance Youths Group
actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: No fewer than 24 members of the Borno youth vigilante popularly known as Civilian JTF were at the weekend killed by suspected Boko Haram members in Mungono local government area of the state. The group was said to be on their way to the hideouts of the Boko Haram sect in Kaleri, Shuwari, Maganari and Nannari villages when they were ambushed and killed. Many other members of the vigilante group are at present unaccounted for. Many civilians were also killed in the attacks.

actor1: Shuwa Ethnic Militia (Nigeria)
actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram kills 14 Shuwa Arab fighters after they came to assist the embattled BVYG.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Gunmen suspected to be Boko Haram's members attacked a nomadic Shuwa-Arab village (not named) and shot dead 17 herdsmen.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram attacks Konduga and Nganzai local government areas, killing 24 over two days. In retaliation military forces pursued the perpetrators to their camps near Gajiram with air support and about 50 insurgents were killed in a shootout.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram attacks Konduga and Nganzai local government areas, killing 24 over two days. In retaliation military forces pursued the perpetrators to their camps near Gajiram with air support and about 50 insurgents were killed in a shootout.

notes: Gunmen suspected to be Boko Haram stormed the northeast Borno town of Gajiran, opening fire in a market and killing 15 people, all of which were civilian. The attackers also laid siege to a police post and a government building.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Suspected Boko Haram gunmen killed a top aid to the Borno State governor along with eight others and abducted a family of five at Bulabulin-Ngabura Village, 50km from Maiduguri.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Gunmen suspected to be Boko Haram stormed the northeast Borno town of Gajiran, opening fire in a market and killing 15 people, all of which were civilian. The attackers also laid siege to a police post and a government building.
