actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Around 800 Boko Haram militants attacked the town of Fotokol, killing 81 civilians and setting fire to buildings before being repelled by regional forces. Up to 500 civilians were wounded

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: 13 - 16 Chadian soldiers and 6 - 7 Cameroonian troops were killed in a counter-attack by Boko Haram in the northern town of Fotokol before they were able to repel the militants. At least 300 militants were killed in the fighting (Xinhua).

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Military forces believe they have killed Boko Haram commander Muhammed Yusuf, among others, in an air strike in the north east. Specific location, date and causality number not known.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram launched simultaneous attacks on Bosso and near Diffa. Troops from Niger and Chad fought back and killed 109 militants in total. Four soldiers also died in the clashes.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram launched simultaneous attacks on Bosso and near Diffa. Troops from Niger fought back and killed 109 militants in total. Four soldiers also died in the clashes.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram staged an overnight assault on the town of Diffa. The Niger military fought back and the militants fled. Death toll is unknown.

actor1: Protesters (Cameroon)
notes: Thousands marched in support of the Cameroonian army which is confronting Boko Haram.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram stops a bus near Akada-Banga village of Bama district and abducted about 20 people, including women and children.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram hijacked a bus near Koza, taking eight Cameroonian girls hostage and killing seven, whose bodies they scattered near the border with Nigeria.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram hijacked a bus of 20 passengers in the north between Koza and Mora, killing 12 and incrementally releasing the other 8.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram attacked Diffa and conducted a concurrent suicide bombing in the market left at least six dead and several injured.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram attacks a military barracks in Geidam (Gaida) on 08/02. Heavy fighting reported. Casualties not known.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
source: Sahara Reporters; AFP; Deutsche Welle; AP; Xinhua
notes: Boko Haram continued its assault on Diffa and Bosso, including on a prison in Diffa, and Niger troops successfully repelled them. At least one national guard member was killed at the prison and 3 other soldiers in total, plus a total of 300 Boko Haram fighters from Sunday - Tuesday.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram continued its assault on Diffa and Bosso, and at least one national guard member and 3 other soldiers died in total, plus 300 Boko Haram fighters from Sunday - Tuesday.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Nine Cameroonian soldiers were injured in an attack by Boko Haram.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: 82 Boko Haram insurgents were reportedly killed by troops of the Nigerian Army and Civilian JTF (BVYG) in an attempt to attack Damboa town, the headquarters of Damaboa Local Government of Borno State. Boko Haram attacked the city from Kalla village at noon.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Extremists from Boko Haram attacked the town of Kolofata, looting food and livestock.

actor1: Police Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Suspected Boko Haram attacked a police station in Kanamma, overran the station, abducted and killed a district officer. The station was bombed and destroyed in the attack.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram hijacked a bus of 30 passengers in Tourou.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram launched another attack on Diffa, but the Nigerien military was able to repel them. A total of 300 Boko Haram were killed from Sunday - Tuesday.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: In ongoing clashes between Boko Haram and the Nigerien military, a total of 300 Boko Haram fighters were killed between Sunday- Tuesday.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Defusal: Military forces discover and demobilize 147 Boko Haram bombs in Auno, on the outskirts of Maiduguri.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: A female suicide bomber was shot dead before detonating explosives in Diffa.

actor1: Military Forces of Chad (1990-)
actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram attacked Chadian Army positions in Gamburu on 11/02. Boko Haram fled soon after the initial attack. The source reported eight Chadian soldiers were wounded, three out of 14 Boko Haram vehicles were destroyed, and one was seized. There was no word on whether any Boko Haram fighters had been killed or wounded.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: In ongoing clashes, Boko Haram attacked the positions of the Chadian military and Chad continued to reinforce its positions in Fotokol. 13 militants and one Chadian soldier were killed, several were wounded.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Gunmen suspected to be members of Boko Haram group have reportedly killed seven people after invading Gajiganna market in Magumeri local government area of Borno State.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: At least five people were killed and 20 injured when a female suicide bomber attacked a market in Biu. The affiliation of the bomber was not known, though suspected to Boko Haram.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram attack and kill 12 people in Akida village and nine others in Mbuta, both of Mafa LGA. The attack occurred shortly before the attack on Biu.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram fighters crossed from Baga into Ngoubo and started firing indiscriminately, torching 2/3 of the town. Chadian forces returned fire and routed the militants. At least one civilian - the village chief- and one soldier were killed, along with two Boko Haram fighters.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram insurgents on the morning of 14/02 attacked Dadin Kowa and Hinna towns of Yamaltu/Deba Local Government Area of Gombe State. The attacks began at 6am. Causalities not known.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram burns Dakin Kowa. No causalities or injuries reported - the residents had fled the scene when they saw the attackers coming from a distance.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram insurgents on the morning of 14/02 attacked Dadin Kowa and Hinna towns of Yamaltu/Deba Local Government Area of Gombe State. The attacks began at 6am. Causalities not known.

actor1: Unidentified Communal Militia (Nigeria)
actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Suspected members of Boko Haram attack a police station in Kibiya, one attacker killed during a gun duel. Following the attack a group of armed villagers attacked the fleeing suspects, killing one.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram attacks Gombe, clash with military forces stationed in the city. The fiercest fighting was about three kilometres (two miles) outside the town. Military forces eventually expelled the attackers from the city. At least 50 causalities reported. Following the attack the Gombe state government imposed a curfew on the city.

actor1: Police Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram attacks a police station in Kibiya, two dead. A similar attack occurred in nearby Sumaila earlier in the day.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: A suspected female Boko Haram suicide bomber attacked a bus station in Damaturu. At least 13 dead, 32 others injured.

actor1: Jubrin Gunda Militia
actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram attacks the palace Emir of Askira in Askira-Uba on the evening of 15/02, burning the building to the ground before being driven into retreat by a local militia known as Jubrin Gunda. No reported causalities. The following morning a regrouped Boko Haram attacked the village for a second time, killing many residents (numbers not given), burning and destroying houses.

actor1: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-)
notes: A human rights group claims Cameroons security forces have been using torture and illegal detention in the fight against Boko Haram in the far north. 50 people reportedly suffocated while locked in a cell and were buried in mass graves.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Military forces report killing 300 members of Boko Haram over two days of fighting in several Borno locations, including: Monguno, Gabchari, Abba Jabari, Zuntur, Gajigana, Gajiram, Damakar, Kumaliwa, Bosso Wanti, Jeram and Kabrisungul. Additionally, the military reports two soldier deaths, plus ten wounded. Later reported indicate that military forces regained control of the effected areas. Dates vary from report to report; battles are believed to have occurred 15/02-16/02.

Apparently, the attacks were in reprisal for a Chadian offensive against its hideouts. Mudu was reportedly the hardest hit. The perpetrators targeted mainly Shuwa tribesmen, who are from the same ethnic group as a large number of the Chadian troops. Witness: "They would ask if a person is Kanuri or Shuwa. Once a person was identified as Shuwa_ he would be shot in the back." Death totals reported as high, though no specific numbers provided.

actor1: Military Forces of Chad (1990-)
notes: The Chadian and Niger armies, which are positioned in the southeastern part of Niger, launched a large scale air and ground offensive on Nigerian territory very early on Sunday [8 March] against Boko Haram positions opposite the Niger cities of Diffa and Bosso. The militaries reported Boko Haram small arms fire shortly after crossing the Doutchi Bridge, which leads to Nigeria from southern Niger. A military source stated that before the ground attack, the air force attacked [Boko Haram positions] in the area for two days. 200 Boko Haram reported dead, 10 Chadian soldiers killed (Agence France Presse). It is not clear if the dead are accounted from the land forces or air bombings from the two previous days.

notes: Around 8,000 people marched against Boko Haram and to show solidarity with the security forces.

notes: Military forces report they have cleared Goniri of Boko Haram elements. No reported exchange of violence.

notes: Military forces battle Boko Haram in Damasak for a second day. The fighting "led the death of many people."

notes: Youths of NUAT hold a rally in support of the Nigerian military in its effort against Boko Haram.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Boko Haram kills 11 in Gamboru over two days of attacks; eight the first, three the second. The attacks followed the withdraw of Chadian Forces from the area.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Suspected Boko Haram gunmen beheaded 23 people, injure 32 others and set fire to homes in Buratai. The attack come on the eve of an election, which Abubakar Shekau had vowed to disrupt.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
notes: Military forces retake Gwoza while killing several members of Boko Haram and capturing several others. Numbers not provided.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Suspected Boko Haram attacked the neighbouring villages of Birin Bolawa and Birin Fulani, opening fire on polling stations. The attackers were heard saying 'Didnt we warn you about staying away from (the) election?' Boko Haram leader Abubakar Shekau had recently warned Nigerians to not participate in the election. One dead in Birin Bolawa, one in Birin Fulani. Later reports suggest there were a total dead of 14 between Birin and Dukku

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Boko Haram gunmen open fire on residents of Miringa, killing 25. The killing may be in relation the election. The attack occurred early in the day.

actor1: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-)
notes: 20 March-5 April. A video emerged in July 2018 showing soldiers executing two women and two children. Analysis has determined that the incident likely occurred between 20 March - 5 April 2015 near a military barrack by Zelevet. Seven soldiers were later arrested for the incident. The civilians were suspected of helping Boko Haram.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Suspected Boko Haram gunmen attacked the town of Dukku, 80 kilometres (50 miles) from the state capital Gombe city, at about 11:30, shooting randomly as voters queued up at polling stations. The attackers killed three and injured two others. Following the initial attack the gunmen then moved to Tilen location killing a state assembly lawmaker and the local chief of the area. Later reports suggest there were a total dead of 14 between Birin and Dukku

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Suspected Boko Haram gunmen attack the outskirts of Nafada in an attempt to disrupt ongoing elections. Casualties not known.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Believed fleeing a battle in Dungulbi, a member of Boko Haram shoots and kills a civilian man in nearby Bishi.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Property destruction: Suspected Boko Haram destroys a number of polling boxes in Bauchi.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
notes: Chadian and Nigerian forces overtake Badam (Abadam) from Boko Haram, kill 50.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
notes: Nigerian forces battle "scores" of Boko Haram fighters outside Bauchi, in the town of Dungulbi. The ground attack was aided by air support. Military sources claim Boko Haram has suffered "serious losses" during the operation.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
notes: Four Boko Haram combatants are killed in a clash with military forces in Gombe Aba.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
notes: Military forces repel a Boko Haram attack on Dukku, at least one captured. Recovered from Boko Haram was include a Hilux van, a smart card reader machine belonging to the Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) and three boxes of assorted ammunition, among other items.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Troops from Niger and Chad killed 40-47 Boko Haram fighters when they repelled an attack in Bosso.

actor1: Tafawa-Balewa Communal Militia (Nigeria)
notes: Boko Haram members attack Tafawa-Balewa during the morning hours, shooting sporadically. The attackers were pushed back by a group of vigilantes, who killed four. The vigilantes pursued them to Jitar.

actor1: Jitar Communal Militia (Nigeria)
notes: Members of Boko Haram kill three Tafawa-Balewa vigilantes perusing them in Jitar.

actor1: Protesters (Nigeria)
notes: Hundreds of Nigerians marched to support Chadian and Cameroonian troops fighting against Boko Haram.

actor1: Military Forces of Chad (1990-)
notes: Nine Chadian soldiers were killed and 16 wounded after being ambushed by Boko Haram fighters in Malam Fatori.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: An explosion in the early evening near a bus station in the northeast city of Gombe killed ten and injured several others. The attack had the "hallmarks" of Boko Haram and witnesses described the attack as the work of a female suicide bomber.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Four fishermen were beheaded and dumped inside the river Alau by suspected Boko Haram on 03/03. After - and separate even- a group of Civilian JTF chased the attackers to a nearby Balle village (not named), where they killed at least one perpetrator.

actor1: BVYG: Borno Vigilance Youths Group
notes: Four fishermen are beheaded and dumped inside the river Alau (in Konduga) by suspected Boko Haram on 03/03. A group of Civilian JTF chased the attackers to a nearby Balle village (not named), where they killed at least one perpetrator.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Boko Haram ambushed civilians going to market and killed 7 with knives and guns.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)

actor1: Rioters (Nigeria)

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
notes: Military forces recapture Boko Haram camps in Alagarno following a raid. Military forces report "huge" Boko Haram losses - no numbers provided.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Suspected Boko Haram insurgents attacked Buratai village in Biu local government area of Borno State where they killed two people and injured three others.

notes: Boko Haram attacked Dabanga village and killed three civilians.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
notes: Military forces recapture four towns (not named) from Boko Haram in the Sambisa forest region. Two are killed when a group of 20 unidentified gunmen attacked Eku village, Ethiope East. The operation is believed to have begun on 09/04, possibly before.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Boko Haram militants, the deadly Islamist sect, has attacked two villages - Bia and Blaberi - overnight in northern Cameroon. Most recent death toll indicates 19 people killed in the violence; many of the victims decapitated.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Boko Haram militants, the deadly Islamist sect, has killed no fewer than 10 people in overnight attacks on two villages in northern Cameroon. There were consecutive attacks by Boko Haram in Bia and Blaberi in the district of Kolofata in the early morning, the military reported.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)

The operations against Boko Haram included overrunning their controlled areas of Tokumbere, Wulari Bukar, Gangala, Anguwar Bakwai, Jigide, Kotorima, Lagura Bello and Lagina Fulani. The nature of any violence is not clear, though military command reports the death of at least one soldier.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
notes: Military forces launch a weekend (02/05) offensive against "insurgent militias" in Wase and Langtang areas, killed 28. The effected areas of Wase included Kadarko, Kurmi and Wadata. One soldier was reported missing. Though the insurgents are not identified they are not believed to be affiliated with Boko Haram. Some of the deaths may have been civilian; other reports claim the soldiers shot "anyone in sight." Fatality numbers vary.

notes: Boko Haram killed at least five civilians and burned houses and vehicles in an attack on Koukoudou village. They also looted homes and shops before withdrawing back into Nigeria.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: A gunman/suicide bomber suspected to be Boko Haram opened fire on Friday (08/05) outside a school in northeast city of Potiskum, seriously wounding 12 students. Only the bomber was confirmed killed. Later reports confirmed a total of three deaths, plus the bomber (Leadership).

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Boko Haram clashed with the Cameroonian military on a patrol near Zevelet, killing two soldiers, and injuring three soldiers and a civilian. The military returned fire, killing around 60 militants.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: A Cameroonian soldier was killed and two others injured while on patrol in the far north when they were ambushed by Boko Haram militants.

actor1: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-)
notes: Movement of forces: Cameroon sent military reinforcements to the border with Nigeria, near Maroua, in anticipation of further fighting with Boko Haram.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Boko Haram launches an attack on Giwa Barracks in Maiduguri, in an attack that included heavy artillery fire and suicide bombers. Military forces repelled the attackers, many residents fled the area. 55 villagers were killed in raids in Kayamla and Bale areas. "Many" Boko Haram fighters killed - exact figures not known (at least six "vigilantes" were killed by a pair of female suicide bombers who pretended to be in distress, three other soldiers killed). Later estimates believe the total was no less than 12.

notes: At least eight people were killed in Gur village of Biu local government area of Borno State as a group of Boko Haram insurgents invaded the community at about 12 midnight.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Boko Haram attack Mule location outside of Maiduguri, causalities not known.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
notes: Boko Haram overtakes Marte, casualties not known.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: A twelve year-old girl detonates a suicide pack at a Damaturu bus depot killing seven (some sources 8) in injuring 31. Boko Haram is believed to be involved.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Boko Haram attacks Sabon Gari Hyembula of Madagali, kills three and abducts seven.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Boko Haram members on May 18, 2015 evening reportedly attacked Madagali community in Adamawa State, and killed about 24 people. They also abducted women and children, even as they reportedly destroyed houses and other properties during the attack on the community.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: A suicide bomber strikes a cattle marker in Garkida, Gombi LGA, ten dead plus injuries. Boko Haram suspected.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Eight are dead following a Boko Haram suicide attack at a market in Garkida, Adamawa.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Suspected Boko Haram gunmen attack Madagail, kill 12 and injure others.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Days following a Fulani attack on Barikin Ladi LGA, members of Boko Haram attack the villages of Ropp (on 20/05) and Inding (on 21/05). This could be interpreted as a count in the larger area throughout the week.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Boko Haram attacks the village of Jwamda-Kobla in Madagali the early morning of 22/05. Causalities not known.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
notes: Military forces kill "scores" of Boko Haram fighters and rescued 20 of their hostages in a raid in Sambisa Forest. One soldier died while 10 others were wounded in the assault on rebel bases.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Boko Haram attacks Kamburo Karaga, killing 10 residents. Date vague - the attack took place "at the weekend."

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: A number of Boko Haram fighters aged between 12 and 16 attacked Gubio the evening of 24/05, killing 37 residents and destroying over 400 homes.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
notes: Military forces repel a Boko Haram on Mafa, killing 30, including a foreign-born commander. The commander was discovered to have thousands of Euros on his person.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Boko Haram attacked Chadian military forces on the island of Choua in Lake Chad. 4 soldiers and 33 militants were killed.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Suspected Boko Haram target a wedding in Tashon Alade with a suicide blast. Six deaths reported.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Boko Haram attack Maiduguri with a series of RPGs, military forces retaliate, forcing the attackers into retreat. The fighting was most heavily concentrated in the Dala suburb to the south of the city. Between 7-15 causalities reported from the grenade attacks.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (2015-)
notes: Boko Haram attack Maiduguri with a series of RPGs, military forces retaliate, forcing the attackers into retreat. The fighting was most heavily concentrated in the Dala suburb to the south of the city. Causalities not known.

actor1: Protesters (Cameroon)
notes: Women from 11 Protestant organizations marched for peace and against Boko Haram.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: A suspected Boko Haram suicide bomber detonated a pack at a market area in Maiduguri, killing 13, injuring 24. Some sources count the dead as many as 20.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (2015-)
notes: A suspected Boko Haram suicide blast kills four soldiers at a military checkpoint in Maiduguri on 04/06.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Two suspected Boko Haram suicide bombers killed at least 31 people and injured 38 others in a crowded market in the northeast Nigeria city of Yola on 04/06.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (2015-)
notes: Military forces shoot and kill two suspected Boko Haram suicide bombers in Shettimari.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: A bomb kills 16 in Musari, outside of Maiduguri. Boko Haram suspected. Most of the dead were traders.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (2015-)
notes: Military forces clash with Boko Haram at Ungwan Keke-B village in Chikun local government area. One Boko Haram death reported.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Suspected Boko Haram female suicide bomber detonated along Baga/Monguno (likely in Marte), killing herself and two others.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Fifteen are dead and several buildings destroyed when Boko Haram gunmen attacked Huyum village on 08/06.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Detonation: Three female Boko Haram suicide bombers detonate themselves in Konduga. Only the bombers reported killed.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Boko Haram attacks the Sambisa Forest villages of Matangale, Buraltima and Dirmanti of Borno on 09/06, opening fire on villagers before looting and burning homes. 43 reported dead.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Two Cameroonian soldiers were killed and around 20 injured when Boko Haram attacked using grenades in the far north.

actor1: Rioters (Nigeria)

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
source: Daily Leadership (Nigeria); Xinhua; Deutsche Welle; AP
notes: Suicide bombers on motorcycles simultaneously attacked police headquarters and the national police academy, killing at least 23 immediately, with a final death toll of 37. A security official said the attack had the hallmark of the Boko Haram.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Boko Haram launched a coordinated attack against three Borno villages on 01/07: Kukawa (97 dead) and two small, unidentified villages near Monguno (48 dead). The attacks occurred in the night-time hours. Boko Haram entered the villages after fleeing an aerial bombardment by military forces in Monguno LGA. Conflicting accounts claim many of the deaths occurred when members of a vigilante group discovered a number of Boko Haram IEDs, which exploded in their presence.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Twin suicide blasts killed at least 13 and injured 17 others, many of them soldiers, at a bar in the border town of Fotokol. The bombers were dressed in burqas and struck as locals were breaking their Ramadan fast. Of the 13 killed (all reportedly during the first blast at the bar), 1 was a Chadian soldier, while of those wounded at least 4 were Chadian soldiers and 3 were Cameroonian soldiers. Most of the soldiers were wounded in the second attack which hit as soldiers from a nearby special forces camp approached the bar after the first blast, although other reports say the second bomber headed straight for the military camp and there was a gunfight before the detonation. The attack were claimed by Boko Haram.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (2015-)
notes: Boko Haram attacks Kukuwa Tasha village, Gujba local government area of Yobe state on 13/08, battles military forces. Initial reports claim four members of Boko Haram, one civilian dead, though some witnesses claim eight were shot. Later reports from witnesses claim the attack and subsequent fighting was on intense the civilian population fled, 150+ drowning in a nearby river - Boko Haram may have facilitated the drowning. Further, one witness claims Boko Haram, upon entering the village, indiscriminately began opening fire on the villagers. The military, however, disputes these claims, though have confirmed a Boko Haram commander was killed in the fighting.

notes: Two Boko Haram suicide bombers detonated explosives outside a mosque, killing themselves and injuring 27.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: A vigilante group chased away a Boko Haram suicide bomber, who then detonated, killing only herself.

actor1: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-)
notes: 04 January. 2 soldiers killed 2 police officers, accused of working in intelligence positions with Boko Haram in Dabanga, Logone Birni.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: an attack by Boko Haram against the village of Ouro-Mari in the Makary Subdivision is foiled by a military response.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Boko Haram ambushed a vehicle transporting the Special Commissioner to Dabanga and the local chief of police, Ismaila Sago, kidnapping them. Two civilians dead.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: A Boko Haram suicide bomber detonates a pack at Izge Gwoza and Izge Dambuwa in Gwoza Local Government area of Borno State at the border of Adamawa State, killing 26.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Attack or clash reported involving Boko Haram; casualties unknown.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (2015-)
notes: Military forces allegedly kill three civilians (a female teacher and two middle-aged men) they suspected of being Boko Haram, possibly in error.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Boko Haram incursion; one farmer killed, two women kidnapped.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (2015-)
notes: Military forces reported they have rescued 3,212 trapped civilians following a firelight in Dikwa with Boko Haram on 07/01. Causalities not known.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Boko Haram suicide bomber killed himself and injured three in a mosque in Danke village near Kolofata.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Boko Haram suicide bomber killed himself and two others in front of a mosque.

actor1: Protesters (Nigeria)
notes: Villagers of Duku protest the alleged recent killing of three detained persons at the hand of the military. It was reported the military suspected the three of being Boko Haram, possibly in error.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Boko Haram gunmen attacked the village of Goura Tembe in the Makari area, killing one and injuring one and burning part of the town.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Boko Haram gunmen have killed seven people and injured others in a raid on "some (unnamed) villages" in Madagali LGA during the early morning hours of 10/01.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Two were killed overnight in the Kolofata area by Boko Haram. Troops responded and attackers fled.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Defence Forces pushed back an attack by Boko Haram in the Kolofata Sub-division, killing two assailants.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Boko Haram suicide bomber killed himself and 12 civilians at a mosque in Kouyape, also known as Gaboua, just south of Kolofata.

actor1: Police Forces of Nigeria (2015-)
notes: Arrests: Police intercept and arrest 150 members of Boko Haram while travelling near Ore, unconfirmed.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (2015-)
assoc_actor_1: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
notes: 15 December, on or about. Report that military forces and the Civilian JTF sexually assaulted and starved civilians in a Bama Boko Haram displacement camp in "late 2015 and early 2016."

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (2015-)
notes: Military forces repel a Boko Haram attack on Goniri army base during the early morning hours of 15/01, killing 17 of the attackers. One soldier was reported injured.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (2015-)
notes: Military forces repel a Boko Haram attack on Churokusko village in Tarmowa (Tarmua) local government area at the mid-morning of 15/01. Military Forces killed "many" of their attackers.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: At least six soldiers were killed and five wounded when their vehicle hit an explosive device likely planted by Boko Haram.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: 6 Nigerien soldiers killed by mine laid by Boko Haram

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (2015-)
notes: Nigerian troops on 20/01 repelled an evening Boko Haram attack on Buratai town, killing some of the insurgents. At least three of the insurgents were killed and many of them escaped with bullet wounds.

actor1: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
notes: Arrests: Boko Haram kingpin Jarasu Shira was on 20/01 morning arrested in Damboa by the vigilante group known as the Civilian JTF.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Attack or clash reported involving Boko Haram; casualties unknown.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Attack or clash reported involving Boko Haram; casualties unknown.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (2015-)
notes: Nigerian forces stationed in Dikwa repel a Boko Haram attack on the town. No reported causalities. Date not known - source dated 21/01.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Soldier killed by a mine likely planted by Boko Haram.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (2015-)
notes: Three Boko Haram suicide bombers were killed in an attempt to attack Nigerian forces at a Maiduguri checkpoint. One of the attackers were shot by a soldier before he was able to detonate himself. No other causalities.

actor1: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-)
notes: On 22 January, Cameroonian militaries ambushed Boko Haram men in Ashigashiya, Mayo Sava. One dead.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (2015-)
notes: Military forces and Boko Haram clash in Marte, 21 reported dead. The clash occurred at a unreported point between the dates of 18/01 and 22/01.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (2015-)
notes: Military forces and Boko Haram clash in Kuwiya (Kudiye), 10 reported dead. The clash occurred at a unreported point between the dates of 18/01 and 22/01.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (2015-)
notes: Military forces and Boko Haram clash in Mijigine (Mijigete), 10 reported dead. The clash occurred at a unreported point between the dates of 18/01 and 22/01.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (2015-)
notes: Military forces and Boko Haram clash in Ruga Fulani, 8 reported dead. The clash occurred at a unreported point between the dates of 18/01 and 22/01.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (2015-)
notes: Military forces and Boko Haram clash in Ajigin, three reported dead. The clash occurred at a unreported point between the dates of 18/01 and 22/01.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Boko Haram attack left three dead, including a member of a vigilante militia.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Five are killed "early this week" (source date 28/01) when Boko Haram attacked traders in Jawu, near Auno.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Four Boko Haram suicide bombers attacked a market, killing 37 and injuring 81.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Boko Haram attacked and killed a civilian, destroying his house in Babban Gida village.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Cameroon)
notes: On the same night that the military "pushed back" Boko Haram in the area, explosions were heard in military camp in a separate incident.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Military "pushed back" an incursion by Boko Haram, unknown number of deaths reported and at least three civilians wounded.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Two suspected Boko Haram female suicide bombers attacked Chibok Market in Chibok Local Government area of Borno State on 27/01, leaving 14 persons dead and over 24 others seriously injured. Another bomber struck a military checkpoint in the town, injuring two.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (2015-)
notes: Two suspected Boko Haram female suicide bombers attacked Chibok Market in Chibok Local Government area of Borno State on 27/01, leaving 14 persons dead and over 24 others seriously injured. Another bomber struck a military checkpoint in the town, injuring two and killing only herself.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Boko Haram suicide attack on a school killed at least six, including the two attackers, and injured about a dozen more. Vigilante militia arrested two others before they could detonate.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: On 29 January, a military truck was hit by a landmine planted by Boko Haram militants in the area of Ashigashiya, Mayo Sava. 12 people wounded.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: A suspected Boko Haram child suicide bomber detonated his explosive in a grain market in Gombi on 29/01, killing at least 10 people.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (2015-)
notes: Nigerian forces clash with suspected members of Boko Haram in Maiduguri on 30/01. No reported casualties.

actor1: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
notes: At least five members of the Civilian Joint Task Force were killed while four others sustained critical injuries when a Toyota Hilux patrol vehicle rammed into landmines/ Improvised Explosive Devices (IEDs) in Buma, Kaga LGA suspected to have been planted by members of Boko Haram.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Boko Haram attacks Dalori village on 30/01 killing many. Many of the dead were children who had been burnt alive. The attack occurred during the evening hours. The death toll was raised to 101 over the course of the week (The Guardian).

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Vigilantes tried to arrest a suspected member of Boko Haram, which detonated an explosive, killing himself and the three vigilantes. Local imam nearby also wounded.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Boko Haram attacked the village of Madakar, killing 3.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Boko Haram suicide bomber tried to attack a market at Guie on Lake Chad, but was stopped by vigilantes. The bomber detonated, killing a vigilante and himself and wounding over 30.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Boko Haram suicide bomber attacked a mosque in the village of Miterine on Lake Chad, killing himself and two others and wounding 24.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Attack or clash reported involving Boko Haram; casualties unknown.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Military killed 15 Boko Haram militants and captured 2.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (2015-)
notes: Military forces kill 100 members of Boko Haram and rescue 1,200 of their captives following a gun battle in Boboshe village, Dikwa LGA on 01/02. The prisoners were being held at the nearby towns of Garindawaji and Mamawarhi. Later accounts vary - This Day reports the death of 56 and the liberation of 520, other sources vary.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Six people were reportedly killed while one person sustained gunshot injury when suspected members of Boko Haram sect invaded Goniambari village in Kaga Local Government Area of Borno state.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
notes: Five houses destroyed after a large bomb blast in Benin City. Police arrested several suspects. Following the incident it was reported the many residents were panicked, fearing Boko Haram to be responsible, though authorities have not substantiated this. Some residents are hospitalised by the blast.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (2015-)
notes: Nigerian forces intercept a pair of Boko Haram suicide bombers attempting to enter Maiduguri. The two detonated their packs from a distance, killing only themselves.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Boko Haram raided two villages, Mairi and Malari in Konduga Local Government Area of Borno, killing four persons and razing houses in the communities.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Nigeria)
notes: At least 23 people are killed following an attack by gunmen who invaded Kwanar Dutse village of Maru LGA. No group has claimed responsibility, though locals fear Boko Haram may be responsible. Date of attack not entirly clear, "[occurred during the weekend]".

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: At least 10 persons were confirmed dead with scores injured when a group of Boko Haram invaded Mairi Mmumbe village, near Dalori of Konduga Local Government Area of Borno State.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: On 8 February, Boko Haram elements killed a person and injured another during an incursion in Shahat, Logone et Chari.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Property destruction: On 8 February, Boko Haram men burned down 246 houses, 1 school and 4 churches during an incursion in Hidoua, Mayo Tsanaga.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Boko Haram attacked a group of firewood traders in Jawu village, about 8 kilometres from Auno town of Kondiga, west of Maiduguri, killing five.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Attack or clash reported involving Boko Haram; casualties unknown.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: On 9 February, Boko Haram elements killed 3 people during an incursion in Gore Moussa, Logone et Chari.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Attack or clash reported involving Boko Haram; casualties unknown.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: On 10 February, Boko Haram elements attacked Bla Dole, Logone et Chari. Causalities unknown.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Two Boko Haram suicide bombers kill six and wound 50 civilians.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Boko Haram kill seven villagers and burn three churches in Tourou.

actor1: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-)
notes: Cameroonian soldiers launch a cross border raid against Boko Haram at Goshi location (in or near Ashigashiya) on 11/02, killing at least 27.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (2015-)
notes: Military forces ambushed a group of Boko Haram fighters at Gwai Mainari in Mainok on 11/02. "Some" Boko Haram were killed in the attack, others injured, weapons recovered.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (2015-)
notes: Soldiers traversing Dogon Gida and New Marte stepped on an undetected Improvised Explosive Device (IED) buried by suspected Boko Haram. The explosion caused four injuries and damage to the vehicle. Elsewhere in the area (unknown exact location), military forces in a joint operation with Cameroonian forces killed 10 members of the group while recuing 45 female captives. The source states the "military forces advanced to Mararraba, Angwan Fada, Dale, Wizha, Bokko Timit, Bokko Nasanu, Bokko Hide, up to Ngoshe village where they linked up with the Cameroonians." However, it is not clear where the encounters with Boko Haram occurred.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Boko Haram militants killed at least 30 people during attacks on two villages in Damboa (Yakshari-12/02 and Kachifa-13/02) over two days in Borno State. The attackers looted food supplies, carting away herds, and kidnapping women and children.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: On 13 February, Boko Haram elements killed 13 people during an incursion in Tombokare, Logone et Chari, looting and burning several houses.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Boko Haram militants killed at least 30 people during attacks on two villages in Damboa (Yakshari-12/02 and Kachifa-13/02) over two days in Borno State. The attackers looted food supplies, carting away herds, and kidnapping women and children.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: On 14 February, a military truck was hit by a landmine planted by Boko Haram elements. Two dead and 5 wounded.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Boko Haram attacks Kuda, setting fire to the village. In response to the attack military forces mobilized, though the Boko Haram attack retreated before the soldiers arrived. One woman reported dead from the fire.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (2015-)
notes: Military forces battled Boko Haram on 16/02 in Borno rescuing 350 persons and killing 167 insurgents in separate but nearby operations in Gajibo, Maula, Gamai, Gamare, Maiwa, Warsale, Tangli, Tushi, Sowa, Hasanari, Changuwa, Malamaja and Marya towns in Mafa and Dikwa Local Governments Areas.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (2015-)
notes: Military forces attack and recapture the "spiritual" Boko Haram stronghold of Alagarno (which includes Komala, Dole, Kumshi and Moadori), killing two and capturing two leaders, Mustapha Busuru and Usman Abubakar.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (2015-)
notes: Military forces battled Boko Haram on 16/02 in Borno rescuing 350 persons and killing 167 insurgents in separate but nearby operations in Gajibo, Maula, Gamai, Gamare, Maiwa, Warsale, Tangli, Tushi, Sowa, Hasanari, Changuwa, Malamaja and Marya towns in Mafa and Dikwa Local Governments Areas.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (2015-)
notes: Military forces battled Boko Haram on 16/02 in Borno rescuing 350 persons and killing 167 insurgents in separate but nearby operations in Gajibo, Maula, Gamai, Gamare, Maiwa, Warsale, Tangli, Tushi, Sowa, Hasanari, Changuwa, Malamaja and Marya towns in Mafa and Dikwa Local Governments Areas.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (2015-)
notes: Military forces attacked Boko Haram elements at Komala and Musafanari general area coming from Sambisa forest. A number of weapons were recovered. Casualties not known.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (2015-)
notes: During a battle of Nigerian and Cameroonian forces in Kumshe a house with Boko Haram members caught fire in nearby Fatake, killing three members inside.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Two soldiers are killed diffusing a bomb laid by Boko Haram on the Amchide- Kumshe road.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (2015-)
notes: Nigerian and Cameroonian forces engage Boko Haram along the Talala-Banki-Kumshe axis, 23 Boko Haram militants were killed (The Nation), the troops destroyed 4 AK 47 rifles and captured a gun truck mounted with an Anti-Aircraft Gun (AA Gun) and 2 AK 47 rifles, as well as a 60mm mortar. The military forces also rescued 150 prisoners, who were mostly children. Three soldiers injured. Allied forces gained control of the area.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (2015-)
notes: Military forces encounter and stop Boko Haram during a suspected coordinated attack on the Dikwa area. The troops recovered 26 bodies of Boko Haram, while others escaped with gunshot wounds; destroyed 3 VIED, 1 MBIED and two gun trucks. The military deaths not reported.

notes: "Scores" are killed when an improvised explosive device seized from Boko Haram Islamists detonated at a police station in Jimeta, Yola area.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Five killed when their vehicle hit a landmine likely placed by Boko Haram.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Boko Haram abduct six residents of Wawoulle village in Kolofata. The insurgents later execute four of the captors.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (2015-)
notes: Military forces clear a Boko Haram camp at Korohuma (Kotokuma), kill 37 members of the group. Two soldiers reported dead.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Boko Haram raid Kolofata for livestock resulting in a clash between the group and local vigilantes. The vigilantes managed to recover the stolen livestock.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: Boko Haram abduct and kill a livestock breeder during a raid on Kolofata.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: An army vehicle hits a mine laid by Boko Haram. An army captain is killed.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (2015-)
notes: Military forces encounter fleeing Boko Haram near the Sabsawa axis of Sambisa forest. The following clash caused at least one soldier to be injured.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (2015-)
notes: Military forces clear three Boko Haram camps in Alagarno forest on 04/03 (at Biu LGA) at Lawin Meleri, Matiri Bulaka and Aljeri, killing 5 members of the sect and rescuing 63 of their prisoners.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (2015-)
notes: Military forces encounter and clear Boko Haram forces from Amdaga Makaranta and Amdaga Madachi in Gwoza. The same brigade had recently cleared Dure. Two Boko Haram reported dead.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (2015-)
notes: Military forces encounter and clear Boko Haram forces from Dure area on 05/03. "Several" Boko Haram fatalities, three soldiers injured.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (2015-)
notes: Military forces clear Boko Haram from Dousa (Doksa) on 05/03, kill two and recovering weapons. The operation was in coordination with other military exercises in the area.

actor1: Islamic State (West Africa)
notes: The military repels as attack by Boko Haram. No reported casualties.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (2015-)
notes: Boko Haram, in an effort to overtake Gwoza, are intercepted and repulsed at the nearby towns of Bitta (in Damboa) and Pulka. The clash began the evening of 07/03, and continued overnight into the morning of 08/03. The fight was said to have forced the military to deploy fighter jets from Yola to support ground troops who were initially being overwhelmed. Eighteen Boko Haram dead, three soldiers injured.

notes: Military forces engage Boko Haram in Daba Magagi (Daban-Masara), wound and capture a prominent leader of the group.

notes: Military forces clear a Boko Haram camp at Alajeri, Guzamala LGA, killing 40 and recovering weapons on 10/03.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (2015-)
notes: Nigerian forces "at the weekend" repulse a Boko Haram attack on Pulka. A similar Boko Haram attack had occurred in Pulka on 08/03. Seventeen Boko Haram dead, weapons recovered. notes: Boko Haram forces ambush military forces at Banki, four Boko Haram dead, weapons recovered. The ambush occurred "at the weekend."

notes: Military forces clear Boko Haram from Gwashari village along Damboa-Bale road, killing one and capturing three others. They also recovered 1 Dane gun, AK-47 rifle magazine, 2 knives, assorted drugs and the sum of N142,000.

actor1: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-)
notes: More than 1,000 people accused of supporting Boko Haram in Cameroon are being detained in military bases and prisons, often without any evidence, and dozens are dying from disease, malnutrition and torture. Several detainees in the military bases told Amnesty that they were tortured and beaten with sticks, whips and machetes, sometimes until they lost consciousness. According to Amnesty in the main prison in Maroua, the capital of the Far North region, between six and eight people die every month in dirty and overcrowded cells where malnutrition is rife.

notes: Twin explosions in Maiduguri, Borno State capital on Sunday night killed 16 people (14 in Muna Garage, 2 in Muna Dalti), including a wedding team and the suicide bombers. The explosions occurred at Muna Garage and Muna Dalti, suburbs of Maiduguri. Boko Haram are suspected as perpetrators. Other reports indicate a third explosion occurred at an area IDP camp, injuring 10 - it is not known if the bomber was lethally injured in this instance.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (2015-)
actor2: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Nigerian air forces launch a number of air strikes against Boko Haram location around Borno State. Only Arra and Boboshe are listed among the locations. Regarded as a "major success," stating, "[the strikes] destroyed the targeted structures and caused fire around the structures where they were hiding, sending a few survivors scampering for safety. [The helicopters] also strafed the area with rockets, subsequently taking out some of the fleeing Boko Haram survivors." Exact causality figures not known. Recorded as 10 at each location instance.

The mission will also target the arms trade between groups in the state and Cameroonian separatists and the recruitment of mercenaries to fight alongside them. The next day, the Nigerian and Cameroonian militaries re-committed to their joint efforts to fight Boko Haram along Borno's border with Cameroon.
